ratings.comment: No exams! Participation in both section and lecture is mandatory but worth your time if you don't know qual and quant methods. Graded on two papers, two presentations, and attendance. Weekly quizzes can boost your grade a bit tho! Professor was really sweet and if you are a soc major, I would recommend going and talking with him about anything!

I realized about half way through the semester that this class has no exams! Everyone attends lecture anyway (there are small attendance checks). Chaeyoon is engaging and funny (although he sometimes goes off on tangents). The projects are cool, but don't procrastinate on them. Chill class. You get to research whatever you want.

Prof. Lim's lectures were always entertaining. The bulk of the class takes place in discussion though. Two big group projects, weekly readings and quizzes, and a couple other assignments throughout. No exams! Overall, I would definitely recommend this class, I've learned a lot and it'll be useful information regardless of what you choose to pursue.

Prof Lim is an engaging lecturer! He clearly wants his students to succeed and is very approachable if you ever need extra assistance. There were lots of readings but they all correlated directly into what we were doing for the 2 projects throughout the semester. You learn a lot of practical information about sociological research. Would recommend!

Probably the best professor I've had so far at UW. Chaeyoon made a seemingly boring class into something that had pretty interesting lectures. The class is based on 2 research papers as well as weekly readings and weekly quizzes, but he gives the answers to the quizzes during lecture. You can tell that he definitely wants all of us to succeed!!

Prof Lim is one of my favorite professors so far at UW. He is very bubbly and energetic, and works to make lecture enjoyable. There are no tests in his class, just 2 research projects where you are able to research ANYTHING (some students did substance use, sex, etc) , as well as weekly lecture quizzes that he give the answers to in class.

Such a good professor! So bubbly and energetic even when the lecture is so early in the morning. I usually won't go to morning lectures if not mandatory but I honestly used to go just for him at the beginning of the semester. The class itself isn't that fun but not too bad. Definitely recommend this professor though!

This class has no exams, just weekly lecture quizzes that he gives the answers to in class and 2 group research projects. Lectures are kinda boring, but it is a research methods class so that's expected. He's pretty accommodating and tries to make lectures interesting.
Professor Lim is amazing! He is so sweet and really loves what he teaches. He was extremely gracious about COVID circumstances and really cares about his students.
Professor Lim was very knowledgable about the content of soc 357. He always came to lectures prepared and with a full schedule. Very enthusiastic about his work.
He's amazing

He is a very enjoyable professor, and make stats interesting. His passion for it is clearly there. Attendance is not mandatory in lecture (they are in the lab), but you get a 5% bonus for showing up. I felt like I understood better the days that I went but they felt too long . Homework was much harder than the exams (one assignment per week).

His sense of humor is good and almost makes statistics enjoyable. I can see why other people may consider some of his comments as "offensive" if you're sensitive, but it's nothing over the top. He really wants everyone to do well and offers 5% extra credit just for showing up. Tests are extremely easy but the homework is much harder.

Dr. Lim is an excellent professor. He is really funny!! And he is truly passionate about statistics. Take this class with him! I had to take this class even though I got a 5 on the AP Stats exam because it didn't get credit for my major. That being said, the class is even easier (covers less) than AP Stats and so it was super easy for me!

In my opinion, one of the worst professors I have ever had. Nice that there were no exams or finals, but mandatory lectures were horrible. He also was EXTREMELY rude: mocked groups, called out students in lecture, laughed when people answered wrong. Hard to understand. Lectures pointless and made no sense. AVOID THIS CLASS

Stay away from this professor. You will struggle to understand his written and spoken English regarding class direction and quizzes. He is incredibly rude, very absent minded, scatter brained and extremely offensive. Impossible to score perfectly on any assignment. You will be frustrated trying to understand him and get a grade you deserve. *AVOID*

Worst professor I've had yet. He is one of the main reasons I switched out of the Sociology major. His mandatory lectures are unbelievably unclear & you find yourself leaving the lecture extremely frustrated every time. He tries to be funny, but in my opinion it comes off as distasteful and disruptive to the class. Do not take a class with him.
Lim is an extremely funny guy that shows immense excitement for the subject; a rarity for sociological methods. He is also good at communication and cares about your thoughts or theories.
Worst professor I have ever had in college

Chaeyoon is a great instructor. He is an expert in his field and is an extremely enthusiastic professor, not to mention pretty humorous as well.  Collective Behavior was easily one of the most enjoyable classes I have taken so far at the UW. Exams are difficult, but if you do the reading and understand the concepts you should be fine.
Great professor.

Collective Behavior - recommend to anyone, esp those with interest in social issues, welfare etc. Uses timely and provoking examples. Class focuses a lot of application of theory w/ current examples. Hard to get into and only teaches every so often. He clearly loves the subject and is excited about teaching. Put in hard work & you'll do well.

The past two comments are ridiculous - Lim really, really wants you to do well in this class and goes out of his way to make it easy for anyone to do so. This is a stats class - obviously it's going to by dry and slightly hard.  Professor Lim is literally brilliant - I think the TA was the problem.

This class is extremely frustrating. Lim swore at us the other day when a large percentage of the class performed poorly on the test and complained about it. It's also very difficult to understand what Lim writes on the board. It's always written over something else and when he tries to explain it, he goes about it in the most round about way.

I don't agree with the previous comments at all. I'm sitting in class right now and everyone is yelling at him after the absurd first test we took in which only 2 people finished on time. He's a terrible teacher and does a horrible job explaining statistics. I'm very good with math and it's sad to watch others fail b/c of his inability to teach.
A fantastic man. Very enthusiastic, uses lots of analogies and examples to explain things, bounces around the room. He is a native Korean, but not at ALL difficult to understand in my opinion.
he's really wants to help you. nice guy too
Easy class. People skipped lectures so he started passing around attendance sheets. Literally just go to lecture and do other work and then write your lecture reactions. Really easy grade!
He's seriously boring...and hard to understand.

His lectures are rather boring but it is statistics so that probably is the reason.  He explains things fairly well and the exams are straightforward.  Probably as good as you can find for a Stats class.
